docs.snippet: Ralph Gibson self-published his own photo books decades ago. Now, those books — filled with dreamlike sequences — have been released in a single volume.

headline.print_headline: The Surrealist Photos of Ralph Gibson
headline.main: The Surrealist Photos of Ralph Gibson

docs.snippet: A Times reporter in Kabul has experienced eight suicide bombings since 2016, seven in the last year. Sick of it, she still goes to the scene. “If I don’t, who will?”

headline.print_headline: When the Bombs Explode, There Is Work to Be Done
headline.main: This Is What I Do When I Hear the Bombs Explode

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: International Women’s Day, North Korea, Tariffs: Your Friday Briefing

docs.snippet: Thursday: Backlash against Attorney General Jeff Sessions’s visit, San Francisco is sinking, and wild turkeys stir divisions in the East Bay.

headline.main: California Today: Peter Thiel Is Leaving Silicon Valley. Will Others?

docs.snippet: Publishers are grappling with how to respond to a cascade of allegations of sexual harassment against authors.

headline.print_headline: Publishers Compelled To Cancel Book Deals Over Sex Misconduct
headline.main: Canceled Deals and Pulped Books, as the Publishing Industry Confronts Sexual Harassment

docs.snippet: False claims posted on Twitter were 70 percent more likely to be shared than the truth, researchers at M.I.T. found. And people appear to prefer false news.

headline.print_headline: Why We’re Easily Seduced by False News
headline.main: It’s True: False News Spreads Faster and Wider. And Humans Are to Blame.

docs.snippet: With their victory after a nine-day walkout, West Virginia teachers demonstrated a new model for collective labor action beyond the traditional parameters of unions.

headline.print_headline: Striking Teachers Defied West Virginia, and Their Own Union, Too
headline.main: West Virginia Walkouts a Lesson in the Power of a Crowd-Sourced Strike

docs.snippet: A retrospective of Lola Flash’s 32-year career is at the Pen and Brush Gallery in Manhattan, showcasing work that delves into questions of identity, race and gender.

headline.print_headline: Beauty, Pride and Power in Photos by Lola Flash
headline.main: Beauty, Pride and Power in Photos by Lola Flash

docs.snippet: After the expulsions of Russian diplomats from the United States and Europe, analysts say relations have reached an alarming state of volatility.

headline.print_headline: It’s No Cold War, but Relations With Russia Turn Volatile
headline.main: It’s No Cold War, but Relations With Russia Turn Volatile

docs.snippet: This week’s Australia Letter features key takeaways from a discussion about democracy and populism with George Megalogenis and A.C. Grayling, plus what’s on Netflix in Australia this month.

headline.print_headline: Too Much Tech and Secrecy, Not Enough Leadership. Discuss.
headline.main: Too Much Tech and Secrecy, Not Enough Leadership. Discuss.
